keys.name: remoteip
keys.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: remoteptr
keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.name: remoteuid
keys.documentation: UNIX socket remote user id (not always available)

keys.name: proxyip
keys.documentation: IP address of the proxy server (not always available)

keys.name: proxytlv
keys.documentation: Any additional PROXY protocol TLV received (not always available, in hex format)

keys.name: close
keys.documentation: Who initialized the disconnect (local or remote)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: An enum to indicate which issued SMTP command triggerd the disconnect

keys.name: type
keys.documentation: The type of error (if avilable, socket or tls)

keys.name: code
keys.documentation: The error code (for socket it’s an errno and for tls it’s an OpenSSL error code)

keys.name: remoteip
keys.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: remoteptr
keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.name: remoteuid
keys.documentation: UNIX socket remote user id (not always available)

keys.name: peercert
keys.documentation: The peer certificate (if provided by the client)

keys.name: x509
keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

keys.name: error

keys.name: senderparams
keys.documentation: Sender parameters to the envelope address (keys will always be in uppercase)

keys.name: recipients
keys.documentation: List of all accepted recipients (envelope), in order of scanning

keys.name: extensions
keys.documentation: The extensions to be sent to the client (if EHLO was issued)

keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

keys.name: username
keys.documentation: SASL username (only available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: password
keys.documentation: SASL password (only available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: SASL state, incremeted per Reply (not available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: response
keys.documentation: SASL response (not available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.documentation: Recipient parameters to the envelope address (keys will always be in uppercase)

keys.documentation: ID of the transport profile to be used

keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

keys.name: senderparams
keys.documentation: Sender parameters to the envelope address (keys will always be in uppercase)

keys.name: recipients
keys.documentation: List of all accepted recipients (envelope), in order of scanning

keys.name: mail
keys.documentation: An instance of the mail message

keys.name: metadata
keys.documentation: User-defined data (only available through the HTTP API)

keys.name: http
keys.documentation: HTTP data (only available through the HTTP API)

keys.name: remoteip
keys.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: remoteptr
keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.name: remoteuid
keys.documentation: UNIX socket remote user id (not always available)

keys.name: x509
keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

keys.name: senderparams
keys.documentation: Sender parameters to the envelope address (keys will always be in uppercase)

keys.name: recipients
keys.documentation: List of all accepted recipients (envelope), in order of scanning

keys.name: queue
keys.documentation: The queue plugin data (not always available)

keys.name: plugin
keys.documentation: Custom queue plugin return value (not always available)

keys.name: return
keys.documentation: Any type passed from custom queue plugin

keys.name: transportid
keys.documentation: ID of the transport profile to be used

keys.name: original
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: modified
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: notify
keys.documentation: The DSN NOTIFY options (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE or DELAY)

predelivery.name: $context
predelivery.documentation: Delivery attempt-bound variable. It is only passed between pre and post-delivery.

keys.name: expired
keys.documentation: If the maximum age or retry count of the message has been exceeded

keys.name: action
keys.documentation: The default action of this execution (“DELETE”, “BOUNCE”, “QUEUE”). Missing on successful deliveries.

keys.name: policy
keys.documentation: The pickup policy information (if an attempt was made)

keys.name: attempt
keys.documentation: The delivery attempt result (if an attempt was made)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: An enum to indicate which issued SMTP command triggerd the result

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: A generic eror message (if no SMTP result)

keys.name: temporary
keys.documentation: If the error may be transient

keys.name: type
keys.documentation: One of config, dns, network, dane,  protocol, smtp, tls or plugin

keys.name: dns
keys.documentation: One of other, nxdomain, nullmx, ipfamily, nodata or excluded (only available if type is dns)

keys.name: transactions
keys.documentation: The number of transactions on this connection

keys.name: localipid
keys.documentation: The source IP ID (name) used (not always available)

keys.name: x509
keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The TLSA name resolution error (if error)

keys.name: plugin
keys.documentation: Custom delivery plugin return value (not always available)

keys.name: return
keys.documentation: Any type passed from custom delivery plugin

keys.name: dsn
keys.documentation: The DSN action and a DSN message id (if generated).

keys.name: action
keys.documentation: DSN type to be generated (delayed, failed, relayed or delivered)

keys.name: id
keys.documentation: ID of the DSN message to be generated

keys.name: diagnostictype
keys.documentation: The DSN diagnostic type (eg. smtp or x-error)

keys.name: queue
keys.documentation: The queue plugin data (not always available)

keys.name: plugin
keys.documentation: Custom queue plugin return value (not always available)

keys.name: return
keys.documentation: Any type passed from custom delivery plugin

postdelivery.name: $message
postdelivery.documentation: The queued message (with modifications from pre-delivery)

keys.name: transportid
keys.documentation: ID of the transport profile to be used

keys.name: original
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: modified
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: notify
keys.documentation: The DSN NOTIFY options (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE or DELAY)

postdelivery.name: $context
postdelivery.documentation: This variable is only defined if the pre-delivery has been executed
